text: King Biscuit Flower Hour Presents Ringo & His New All-Starr Band is a live album by Ringo Starr released on 6 August 2002. ==Overview== Starr's All-Starr Band was always evolving. While Mark Rivera remained from the previous band, the new players for the 2001 US tour here include Emerson, Lake & Palmer's Greg Lake, Mott the Hoople's Ian Hunter and - bringing a more updated sound to the precedings - Supertramp's Roger Hodgson, Howard Jones and former Prince bandmember Sheila E.. Starr naturally has the biggest share of the songs, performing his classic hits from the 1960s and 1970s - with the relatively recent "Don't Go Where the Road Don't Go" from 1992's Time Takes Time, with all his celebrity guests each having their moment in the spotlight. ==Reception== King Biscuit Flower Hour Presents Ringo & His New All-Starr Band was fairly well received by the critics upon its August 2002 release, though again, it failed to reach the charts. ==Track listing== #"Photograph" (Richard Starkey/George Harrison) – 4:21 #"Act Naturally" (Voni Morrison/Johnny Russell) – 2:32 #"Logical Song" (Rick Davies/Roger Hodgson) – 3:55 #* Performed by Roger Hodgson #"No One Is to Blame" (Howard Jones) – 6:11 #* Performed by Howard Jones #"Yellow Submarine" (Lennon–McCartney) – 3:07 #"Give a Little Bit" (Rick Davies/Roger Hodgson) – 5:13 #* Performed by Roger Hodgson #"You're Sixteen" (Richard Sherman/Bob Sherman) – 2:37 #"The No-No Song" (Hoyt Axton/David Jackson) – 3:20 #"Back Off Boogaloo" (Richard Starkey) – 3:57 #"Glamorous Life" (Prince) – 9:18 #* Performed by Sheila E. #"I Wanna Be Your Man" (Lennon–McCartney) – 4:01 #"Lucky Man" (Greg Lake) – 4:44 #* Performed by Greg Lake #"Take the Long Way Home" (Rick Davies/Roger Hodgson) – 4:44 #* Performed by Roger Hodgson #"All the Young Dudes" (David Bowie) – 5:35 #* Performed by Ian Hunter #"Don't Go Where the Road Don't Go" (Richard Starkey/Johnny Warman/Gary Grainger) – 4:39 #"With a Little Help from My Friends" (Lennon–McCartney) – 5:34 ==References== ; Footnotes ; Citations Category:2002 live albums Category:Ringo Starr live albums Category:Albums produced by Ringo Starr
title: King Biscuit Flower Hour Presents Ringo & His New All-Starr Band
